database_info.data_source: Clinical research, meta-analyses, standard therapeutic guidelines
database_info.purpose: Provide therapeutic dosing ranges for dietary supplement ingredients not covered by traditional RDA/UL standards.

therapeutic_dosing.common_use: Mood support, sleep aid, serotonin precursor
therapeutic_dosing.upper_limit_notes: Do not combine with prescription antidepressants (SSRIs, MAOIs). May cause nausea at higher doses.

therapeutic_dosing.common_use: Antioxidant, blood sugar support, neuropathic pain
therapeutic_dosing.upper_limit_notes: May lower blood sugar; monitor if diabetic. Rare reports of skin rash.

therapeutic_dosing.common_use: Adaptogen for stress, thyroid support, sleep
therapeutic_dosing.upper_limit_notes: Long-term safety of very high doses not established. Use caution with thyroid medications.
Standardized to 20-55% bacosides. May cause GI upset in some.

therapeutic_dosing.common_use: Blood sugar regulation, antimicrobial, lipid support
therapeutic_dosing.upper_limit_notes: Can interact with many medications via CYP450 enzyme inhibition. Consult doctor.
Causes harmless paresthesia (tingling). Doses >800mg may be best taken divided.

therapeutic_dosing.common_use: Nitric oxide production, exercise performance, blood flow
therapeutic_dosing.upper_limit_notes: Generally well-tolerated. Very high doses may cause GI distress.

therapeutic_dosing.common_use: Cellular energy production, heart health, antioxidant
therapeutic_dosing.upper_limit_notes: Fat-soluble; take with food. May interact with blood thinners like warfarin.
High doses may cause GI upset. Enhanced formulations (with piperine, phospholipids) greatly increase bioavailability.
May cause headaches or dark urine. Start with a lower dose.
Generally recognized as safe (GRAS). High doses may cause brief tingling or shortness of breath.
May affect blood sugar; monitor if diabetic. Shellfish allergen warning.
Generally well-tolerated. Low molecular weight may be better absorbed.
Exceptionally safe. No known toxicity.
Fat-soluble; take with food. Often paired with zeaxanthin.
Lower doses (0.5-1mg) are often more effective for sleep regulation. Higher doses may cause morning grogginess.
Start with a lower dose to minimize potential detox symptoms. Generally very safe.

therapeutic_dosing.common_use: Glutathione precursor, respiratory health, detox support
therapeutic_dosing.upper_limit_notes: May interact with nitroglycerin and ACE inhibitors. Rare reports of histamine release.
Strain-specific effects are critical. High doses may cause initial bloating. Immunocompromised individuals should consult a doctor.
Often paired with bromelain to enhance absorption. May interact with some antibiotics.
Fat-soluble; take with food. High purity trans-resveratrol is preferred.

therapeutic_dosing.common_use: Adaptogen for stress and fatigue, cognitive enhancement
therapeutic_dosing.upper_limit_notes: Standardized to 3% rosavins and 1% salidroside. May be stimulating for some; avoid late in the day.
Standardized to 85-95% fatty acids. Doses above 320mg show no additional benefit in studies.
**Major Interaction Risk:** Induces CYP450 enzymes. Interacts with antidepressants, birth control, blood thinners, and many others. Contraindicated with many medications.

therapeutic_dosing.common_use: Enhanced bioavailability CoQ10 for energy and heart health
therapeutic_dosing.upper_limit_notes: Considered 2-4x more bioavailable than ubiquinone. Preferred form for those over 40 or with absorption issues.
Standardized to 0.8-1% valerenic acid. May cause drowsiness. Not for long-term continuous use.

therapeutic_dosing.common_use: Strength, power, muscle growth, cognitive function
therapeutic_dosing.upper_limit_notes: Loading phase of 20g/day for 5-7 days is common. Ensure adequate hydration. Generally safe for healthy individuals.

therapeutic_dosing.common_use: Skin, hair, nail, joint, and bone health
therapeutic_dosing.upper_limit_notes: Generally very safe. Can be taken with or without food. Bioavailability varies with form.
May cause drowsiness. Specific form designed to cross blood-brain barrier. Doses are for elemental magnesium.

therapeutic_dosing.common_use: NAD+ precursor, anti-aging, cellular energy support
therapeutic_dosing.upper_limit_notes: Relatively new supplement. Short-term human trials suggest good tolerability. Long-term effects are still under investigation.
